title: The love story between an old man and his 'great oak,' the tallest of its kind in the world
subhead: At the heart of Vallespir, in the Pyrénées-Orientales, Serge Arnaudiès discovered a 300- or 400-year-old cork oak. Recognized as the tallest in the world and labeled an 'Arbre remarquable' ('Remarkable Tree'), the specimen now draws many visitors.

subhead: Only nine technicians remain in the Palestinian enclave who can make or adapt prosthetics, while nearly 4,000 people, including 10% of children, have undergone amputations.
